Description: Bust of General Bonaparte, three quarter face, left, crowned with lotus flowers. (obverse)

Napoleon, laureated, in Roman attire, standing in a heroic pose, right arm extended holding a baton/sceptre, riding a triumphal chariot, on the side of which are suspended two Egyptian quivers of arrows; the chariot is pulled by two camels, richly adorned with Egyptian styled ornamentation, between 'Cleopatra's needle' in the foreground left and 'Pompey's Pillar' in the background; hovering above the scene, Victory, with palm frond and wreath of laurel. (reverse)
Producer name: Die Engraved or Modelled for Reducing Machine: Jouannin
Die Engraved or Modelled for Reducing Machine: Nicolas Guy Antoine Brenet
Bibliographic references: Hennin 1826 / Histoire Numismatique De La Révolution Française (879, p.614)
Laskey 1818 / Description of a Series of Medals Struck at the National Medal Mint by Order of Napoleon Bonaparte (10)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
